# renderingMode

**Instance Property**

The current audio session’s rendering mode.

## Declaration

```swift
var renderingMode: AVAudioSession.RenderingMode { get }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is [doc://com.apple.avfaudio/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioSession/RenderingMode-swift.enum/notApplicable] in the following cases:

- The currently selected port isn’t of type [doc://com.apple.avfaudio/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioSession/Port/carAudio] or, in iOS 18 and later, [doc://com.apple.avfaudio/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioSession/Port/airPlay].
- Your app uses a playback API other than [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVPlayer] or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVSampleBufferAudioRenderer].
- Playback isn’t currently active.
- The audio session is inactive, muted, or not eligible for Now Playing.

## Inspecting rendering mode and capabilities

- **AVAudioSession.RenderingMode**: Audio session rendering mode identifiers.
- **renderingModeChangeNotification**: A notification the system posts when the rendering mode changes.
- **supportedOutputChannelLayouts**: The array of channel layouts that the current route supports.
- **renderingCapabilitiesChangeNotification**: A notification the system posts when the rendering capabilities change.
